Author: h3st
Content:
The Ego and its Own, by Max Stirner. The Open Society and its Enemies, by Karl Popper. The Illuminatus! trilogy.

Robin Hobb books (with special mention of the farseer trilogy), Neal Stephenson, Alan Moore, Terry Pratchett.

Author: gills
Content:
The First Circle (Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn)

LOTR

Siddhartha (Hermann Hesse)

The Odyssey (Homer)

The Dilbert Principle (Scott Adams) -- Alright, not literature! But come on, it's Dilbert :)

Author: jimbokun
Content:
I was starting to freak out when I thought they were ranking ASP/VBscript ahead of Javascript.

Then I realized the list was in alphabetical order.

Author: jgrahamc
Content:
John hired me as VP of Engineering at Scriptics and then he and I founded Electric Cloud together.

I like the 7 point scale because there is a definite ambivalent option. In practice most people have a definite opinion and 4 is not often used.
